Will there be some problems if there are lots of nodes?

If user uses sh sbin/start-server.sh to start server, every node in seednodes should be checked, thus the minimum should be  'getAllNodes().size() - 1'.
If user uses sh sbin/add-server.sh to add server,then this funcation will never be called,the newly added server will try to check status by the node which will help it to join the cluster.
So it seems no problem will occur?
Yes. But I'm not sure if it is possible that there are tens of seed nodes. In that case, will the core pool size be too large for the machine?

I think it's OK to create dozens of threads to accelerate the start-up check as it will only be used during building cluster, so it will cause no effect to cluster's read or write performance. As for the larger cluster such as hundreds of nodes, I think we should change not only the current design of the meta group but also the current p2p mode of checkStatus.
So maybe it's almost OK for current design.
